tool_description:
BOT libre's goal is to foster an open, safe community of artificial intelligent chat bots and their developers.

BOT libre allows you to create your own artificial intelligent chat bot, train them, and share them with others. You are free to use this website, and create your own bots for personal, commercial, or recreation usages.

You can give your bot its own avatar images, connect it to Twitter, or IRC chat.
You can train your bot through interacting with it, or using chat logs.
You can program your bot using a 4th generational state machine scripting language "Self".
You can import data from the web into your bot's memory, such as words from Wiktionary, or information from Freebase.
You can create a bot to act as your own website avatar.
You can create a bot to provide customer service or technical support for your products or services.

BOT libre is a website produced and hosted by Paphus Solutions Inc.
name: BOTlibre
title: BOTlibre

api_list.name: form-check-instance
api_list.description: The form-check-instance API validates that a bot ID or name exists, and returns the bot's details.

required_parameters.name: password
required_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: The password of the user. A token can also be used.

optional_parameters.name: id
optional_parameters.description: REQUIRED: The ID of the bot to validate. The bot's name can also be used, but the ID is better as it is guaranteed to be unique.

optional_parameters.name: name
optional_parameters.description: REQUIRED: The nameof the bot to validate. The bot's ID can also be used.

optional_parameters.name: application
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: The application ID. If not passed, the application will be anonymous.

optional_parameters.name: user
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: The ID of the user. The user must be registered with BOT libre. If not passed the user will be anonymous. The user is required if the bot is private.

optional_parameters.name: token
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: The token of the user. A token can be obtained through check-user, and is valid until reset.

api_list.name: form-check-user
api_list.description: The form-check-user API validates user, and returns the user's details.

required_parameters.name: user
required_parameters.description: REQUIRED: The ID of the user. The user must be registered with BOT libre. If not passed the user will be anonymous. The user is required if the bot is private.

optional_parameters.name: application
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: The application ID. If not passed, the application will be anonymous.

optional_parameters.name: password
optional_parameters.description: REQUIRED: The password of the user. A token can also be used.

optional_parameters.name: token
optional_parameters.description: REQUIRED: The token of the user. A token can be obtained through check-user, and is valid until reset.

api_list.name: form-chat
api_list.description: The form-chat API receives a chat message and returns the chat bot's reply as an XML document.

required_parameters.name: instance
required_parameters.description: REQUIRED: The ID of the bot to chat with. The bot's name can also be used, but the ID is better as it is guaranteed to be unique.

optional_parameters.name: application
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: The application ID. If not passed, the application will be anonymous.

optional_parameters.name: user
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: The ID of the user who is sending the message. The user must be registered with BOT libre. If not passed the user will be anonymous. The user is required if the bot is private. The user/password are only required on the first message.

optional_parameters.name: password
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: The password of the user who is sending the message. A token can also be used.

optional_parameters.name: token
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: The token of the user who is sending the message. A token can be obtained through check-user, and is valid until reset.

optional_parameters.name: conversation
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: The conversation ID for the current conversation. This must not be passed on the first message, but will be returned by the response, and should be used for all subsequent messages in the conversation.

optional_parameters.name: message
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: The chat message to send to the bot. The message can be omitted if you wish the bot to start the conversation (if the bot has a greeting set). The message must be encoded in the URI.

optional_parameters.name: emote
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: A emotion to tag the message with. This is one of LOVE, LIKE, DISLIKE, HATE, RAGE, ANGER, CALM, SERENE, ECSTATIC, HAPPY, SAD, CRYING, PANIC, AFRAID, CONFIDENT, COURAGEOUS, SURPRISE, BORED, LAUGHTER, SERIOUS.

optional_parameters.name: correction
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: A boolean that defines the chat message is a correction to the bot's last answer.

optional_parameters.name: offensive
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: A boolean that defines the bot's last answer as offensive. The message will be flagged for the bot's administrator to review.

optional_parameters.name: disconnect
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: A boolean that defines the end of the conversation.

optional_parameters.name: includeQuestion
optional_parameters.description: OPTIONAL: A boolean that indicates the question should be included in the response.
